original: Chöler, Ernst Anders Carl Gustaf, länsjägmästare. Mariestad, f. 9/12/88 i Ö. Emtervik, Värml. 1., av brukspatr. Ernst C. o. Emilie Timberg. G. 19 m. grev:an Kerstin Sparre. Barn: Ernst f. 20, Eva 22, Ulf o. Ulla 24. — Stud:ex. 07, fil. kand. i Upps. 11, ut-ex. fr. skogsimst. 14. translated: Chöler, Ernst Anders Carl Gustaf, County Forester. Born in Mariestad, December 9th, 1888 in Östra Emtervik, Värmland, to industrialist Ernst C. and Emilie Timberg. Married in 19XX to Countess Kerstin Sparre. Children: Ernst (b. 1920), Eva (b. 1922), Ulf (b. 1924), and Ulla (b. 1924). Education: High school graduation in 1907; Bachelor of Arts from Uppsala University in 1911; graduated from forestry school in 1914. Became a Forester in 1915, assistant to the forestry department in 1915-1917, district chief and county assistant for fuel commission in 1917-1918, deputy county forester in Jönköping in 1918-1922, and county forester in Skaraborg since 1923. Former county captain. Chairman of Mariestad County Association from 1929-1943, Vice Chairman of Skaraborg County Association, alternate board member of Sweden's county associations' steering committee and executive committee member of CFB. Member of the Skaraborg County Hunting Association's board since 1925, board member of Mariestad Shooting Club from 1926-1939, Board member of System A-B in Mariestad since 1929, branch manager of Skaraborg Private Bank in Mariestad since 1934, member of the Western Swedish Foresters Association since 1936, member of the Agricultural Society since 1940, member of the county's Crisis Committee since 1940, board member of Skaraborg L. Interest and Capital Insurance Institution since 1938, Secretary and Treasurer of the County Foresters' Association from 1927-1932, chairman of the Wood Committee in Skaraborg County from 1939-1940 and the Skaraborg County Officers' Association from 1939-1942, and member of the forestry legislation committee from 1942-1946. Recipient of the Royal Order of Vasa, the County Medal, 3 other County Medals, and 2 Silver Medals.
